intro: Sida patuliloba, commonly known as the broadleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and riverbanks. Sida patuliloba is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
